channel.title: Visualization on Research Tools
channel.description: Recent content in Visualization on Research Tools

item.title: Whimsical
item.description: Visual workspace, online tool for quick diagrams

item.title: Bashplotlib
item.description: plotting in the terminal using plaintext

item.title: Colorcet
item.description: Colorcet is a collection of perceptually uniform colormaps for use with Python plotting programs like bokeh, matplotlib, holoviews, and datashader based on the set of perceptually uniform colormaps created by Peter Kovesi at the Center for Exploration Targeting.

item.title: itermplot
item.description: An awesome iTerm2 backend for Matplotlib, so you can plot directly in your terminal.

item.title: plotnine
item.description: Python visualization package that follows the grammar of graphics.

item.title: Seaborn
item.description: statistical data visualization in Python

item.title: D3.js
item.description: The most widely used javascript lib for visualizations in the browser.

item.title: Color Calculator
item.description: Generate color palettes based on harnomy

item.title: ColorBrewer
item.description: Color palete advice for maps

item.title: Paletton
item.description: Generate color palettes

item.title: Wolfram Alpha
item.description: Wolfram Alpha is an AI assistant that does data analysis in a smart way.

item.title: Geogebra
item.description: Geogebra is the classical. GeoGebra can be used for precise charting as well as simple calculations.

item.title: Desmos
item.description: Desmos is a simple online charting tool that creates interactive charts.

item.title: Graph.tk
item.description: Graph.tk is a dead simple online charting tool that creates interactive charts.

item.title: Plotly
item.description: Plotly is a set of open-source graphing libraries. Plotly is the goto library to make interactive charts in Python, R, or JavaScript.

item.title: Mathematica Online
item.description: The online version of Mathematica!

item.title: Cocalc
item.description: A toolkit for coding and writing online. The UI is a bit outdated but the services are real hardcore.

item.title: Azure Notebooks
item.description: Azure notebooks is simply a hosted Jupyter notebook.

item.title: Kaggle
item.description: Kaggle is a competition platform that bundles online computing Jupyter notebooks and data management.

item.title: Next Journal
item.description: NextJournal is the notebook for reproducible research. NextJournal provides poly-language notebooks and beautiful UI.

item.title: Google Colab
item.description: Google Colab is an online version of Jupyter Notebook which allows us to use free computation powers from Google and storage on Google Drive. Google Colab also comes with free GPU hours.
